class_notes:
ITAL 375 sec 1 Sustainable Food Fair (in English) 1 credit Muratore     M-W 4:00- 5:15pm (15 seats)  CO-TEACH with Taylor, Spicer 
This is a one-credit course that provides students an opportunity to lead and promote a deeper understanding of sustainable food and ecological justice among the members of the Emory Community at large. This course enables students to learn about and engage with like-minded individuals within the Atlanta food and beverage industry, local farmers and other specialists committed to sustainable food production practices. We will also examine the concepts of sustainability in relation to food production and the history and principles of the "Slow Food Movement", which was founded in 1989 in Italy to counteract fast food, and to promote local and organic food traditions.


Tasking the students with the execution of this project will allow them to further their leadership skills, demonstrate their commitment to sustainability and enable them to become agents of social change.  
The fair will be held on Tuesday, October 4. 
The class meets on Mondays and Wednesday from 4:00 to 5:15pm. Last day of class is October 5th, 2021 
The Sustainable Food Fair is supported by the Emory Office of Sustainability Initiative.  
This class is suitable for First Year students.
course_description: Topics to be announced each semester. Course taught in English. May be repeated for credit when syllabus changes. Focus on developing critical analysis and reasoning skills.
